Highly Recommended (180+ Hours Played)

I've poured over 180 hours into F1 Manager 2024, and it is, without a doubt, the best and most complete entry in the series. While it‚Äôs bittersweet to know that Frontier won't be continuing the franchise, this game stands as a fitting‚Äîif tragic‚Äîhigh point and a must-have for any management sim enthusiast, especially those who crave F1 immersion.

The core simulation and management loop is utterly addictive. This year's inclusion of Create A Team (CAT) is the absolute game-changer the series always needed. The level of customization, from defining your team's origin story and starting funds to designing every detail of your livery and race suits, provides immense replayability. Finally being able to build a legacy from scratch, bringing in fresh drivers and staff, is what kept me glued to the pit wall for dozens of seasons.

The mechanical failures and the overhauled Mentality System add a crucial layer of depth, ensuring that races are never a simple cruise and that off-track decisions genuinely matter. Watching a well-executed strategy pay off‚Äîor a poorly managed driver morale tank your results‚Äîis what makes the management aspect so rewarding.

If you love detailed simulation, intricate strategic planning, and the pure satisfaction of building a champion from the ground up, you need this game.

The Downside:

It is truly upsetting that this is where the road ends for the series. Frontier finally delivered the complete package fans wanted with Create A Team and other crucial systems, only for commercial results to reportedly halt future development. This game shows what could have been, and its excellence makes the discontinuation even harder to stomach.

Verdict: Buy it, cherish it, and start that custom career. You'll lose hundreds of hours to the management loop, and you'll love every minute. It's the definitive F1 management experience, even if it is the last.

negative.review:
The game looks good, especially for a first season. However, it quickly becomes boring ‚Äî at least for me.
Most of the time, you're doing the same few tasks between races, and the races themselves are exactly the same. During the first season, it's enjoyable to look forward to improving your car, but then you start juggling upgrades for both this year's car and next year's. The process is pretty much the same for both ‚Äî mainly managing time and manpower.
The scouting and contracts seem superficial with little real depth.
There are also some small, annoying issues:
1) In your second year, why can't you see last year's setup? I imagine most teams would start with their previous setup and tweak from there, rather than starting each race with a standard configuration.
2) On street circuits, the number of safety cars is excessive. It almost makes me want to give up on these races. A better strategy might be to keep a fresh set of soft tires for near the end. If you can guess when the last red flag will occur, you could pit then and go from there.
3) What happens to my boardroom and heli pad? They need constant upgrading. Once your team reaches five stars, a bit of polish would suffice.

4). Cant touch engines, I know F1 is locked but they do have rules changes that allow changes, maybe I didnt play it long enough.   But seems like something that could be added to add something a little more.

Overall if it goes on sale give it a go, you easy get a season out of it, but then it can get very reptative.

Most of the time, you're doing the same few tasks between races, and the races themselves are exactly the same. During the first season, it's enjoyable to look forward to improving your car, but then you start juggling upgrades for both this year's car and next year's. The process is pretty much the same for both ‚Äî mainly managing time and manpower.
The scouting and contracts seem superficial with little real depth.
There are also some small, annoying issues:
1) In your second year, why can't you see last year's setup? I imagine most teams would start with their previous setup and tweak from there, rather than starting each race with a standard configuration.
2) On street circuits, the number of safety cars is excessive. It almost makes me want to give up on these races. A better strategy might be to keep a fresh set of soft tires for near the end. If you can guess when the last red flag will occur, you could pit then and go from there.
3) What happens to my boardroom and heli pad? They need constant upgrading. Once your team reaches five stars, a bit of polish would suffice.

4). Cant touch engines, I know F1 is locked but they do have rules changes that allow changes, maybe I didnt play it long enough.   But seems like something that could be added to add something a little more.

Overall if it goes on sale give it a go, you easy get a season out of it, but then it can get very reptative.
